DOCNAME: CASE OF EMİNE ARAÇ v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim rejected;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient
JUDGES: Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , a student in ORG in ORG , sought to enrol in ORG of ORG . For that purpose she provided , among other materials , an identity photograph which showed her wearing a headscarf .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG replied to the applicant , informing her that the identity photograph she had supplied did not comply with the regulations in force and that where this was the case , the person concerned could not be enrolled .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant lodged an application for judicial review with ORG . She requested , in particular , that the refusal of the administrative authorities be set aside as being in breach of her rights .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE , ORG rejected the application , finding that the authorities’ refusal had been in accordance with the regulations in force . The court considered , in particular , that the applicant had submitted an identity photograph which did not conform to the regulations , which stipulated that “ photographs must show the subject facing forward and be DATE , so that the person concerned is readily identifiable ; the head and neck must also be uncovered ” ( LAW ( f ) of ORG adopted by ORG on DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Following an appeal by the applicant on points of law , ORG upheld the judgment of DATE , finding it to have been in accordance with the law and the procedural rules . The relevant parts of ORG judgment read as follows :
Opinion of PERSON , investigating judge of ORG : the judge is of the opinion that the appeal should be dismissed and the first - instance judgment upheld .

Opinion of Mr PERSON , ORG ( savcı ) at ORG : the grounds of appeal set out in the statement of grounds do not correspond to those enumerated in LAW . In view of the juridical and legal arguments on which the first - instance judgment was based , these grounds can not be said to require the quashing of the impugned judgment ... ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW reads as follows :
“ No one may be deprived of the right to instruction and education .
The scope of the right to education shall be defined and regulated by law .

Instruction and teaching shall be provided under the supervision and control of the ORG in accordance with the principles and reforms of PERSON and contemporary scientific and educational methods . No educational or teaching institution may be set up that does not follow these rules .
